Influence of observations Plot in D3 with r2d3 Package.
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Model Evaluation Audit
    • Model Fit Audit

    • Model Residuals Audit
    • Observation Influence Audit
  • Changelog

Influence of observations Plot in D3 with r2d3 Package.

Cook’s distances are used for estimate the influence of an single observation. If the picture is not displayed in the viewer, please update your RStudio.

plotD3CooksDistance(object, ..., nlabel = 3, single_plot = FALSE,
  scale_plot = FALSE, background = FALSE)

Arguments

object

An object of class modelAudit or observationInfluence.
...

Other modelAudit or modelResiduals objects to be plotted together.
nlabel

Number of observations with the biggest Cook's distances to be labeled.
single_plot

Logical, indicates whenever single or facets should be plotted. By default it's FALSE.
scale_plot

Logical, indicates whenever the plot should scale with height. By default it's FALSE.
background

Logical, available only if single_plot = FALSE. Indicates whenever backgroud plots should be plotted. By default it's FALSE.

See also

plotCooksDistance

Examples

library("auditor")
library(car)

lm_model <- lm(prestige~education + women + income, data = Prestige)
lm_au <- audit(lm_model, data = Prestige, y = Prestige$prestige, label = "lm")
plotD3CooksDistance(lm_au)

library(randomForest)
rf_model <- randomForest(prestige~education + women + income, data = Prestige)
rf_au <- audit(rf_model, data = Prestige, y = Prestige$prestige, label = "rf")
plotD3CooksDistance(lm_au, rf_au, nlabel = 4)
